body.body: Lubricate each gear and bush with clean engine oil during assembly.
Examine all gears, bearings and sleeves for damage, chipped teeth and wear beyond the service limits. Replace all suspect components and always use new circlips to assemble the shaft.
The numbers in brackets in the following text refer to the exploded view

Working from the output sprocket end of the output shaft (19), fit a new bearing (25) and new sleeve (26) to the shaft using a press and press bars. Fit the sleeve with the large chamfer facing outwards.
Fit the retaining ring (23) to the shaft. Lubricate and fit a new oil seal (24).
Position the shaft to a vice and secure between soft jaws. Fit the sprocket (22), locktab (21) and sprocket nut (20). Tighten the nut to
Withdraw the shaft from the vice and continue to assemble from the opposite end to the output sprocket.
Locate the second gear (18) to the output shaft with the large step side facing away from the output sprocket end. Fit the thrust washer (17) and retain with a new circlip (16).
Fit sixth gear (15) with the selector fork groove facing away from the output sprocket end. Ensure that the oil holes in the gear DO NOT align with the corresponding oil hole in the output shaft.
If the oil holes in the sixth gear are aligned with the corresponding hole in the output shaft, engine oil pressure and gear lubrication will be reduced.
Reduced oil pressure and gear lubrication will cause engine damage and could also lead to engine seizure resulting in loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Fit a new circlip (14) to retain sixth gear (15).

Fit the thrust washer (13) to the rear of third gear (11). Fit the third gear bush (12) for fourth gear, ensuring that the oil hole in the output shaft DOES NOT align with the hole in the bush. Fit third gear (11) to the shaft with the large step side facing towards the output sprocket.
Fit fourth gear (10) with the larger step side facing away from the output sprocket.
Fit the thrust washer (9) and retain with a new circlip (8).

Fit the fifth gear (7) to the output shaft (19) with the selector fork groove facing towards the output sprocket. Ensure that the oil holes in the gear DO NOT align with the corresponding oil hole in the output shaft.
If the oil holes in the fifth gear are aligned with the corresponding hole in the input shaft, engine oil pressure and gear lubrication will be reduced.
Reduced oil pressure and gear lubrication will cause engine damage and could also lead to engine seizure resulting in loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Fit the first gear thrust washer (5) and bearing (6).
Fit first gear (4) to the shaft as marked during disassembly.
Fit the thrust washer (3), needle roller bearing (2) and bearing sleeve (1) to the end of the shaft.

search: Output Shaft - Assembly
Lubricate each gear and bush with clean engine oil during assembly.
Examine all gears, bearings and sleeves for damage, chipped teeth and wear beyond the service limits. Replace all suspect components and always use new circlips to assemble the shaft.
The numbers in brackets in the following text refer to the exploded view
Exploded View â€“ Output Shaft

Working from the output sprocket end of the output shaft (19), fit a new bearing (25) and new sleeve (26) to the shaft using a press and press bars. Fit the sleeve with the large chamfer facing outwards.
Fit the retaining ring (23) to the shaft. Lubricate and fit a new oil seal (24).
Position the shaft to a vice and secure between soft jaws. Fit the sprocket (22), locktab (21) and sprocket nut (20). Tighten the nut to
132 Nm
. Close the lock tab.
Withdraw the shaft from the vice and continue to assemble from the opposite end to the output sprocket.
Locate the second gear (18) to the output shaft with the large step side facing away from the output sprocket end. Fit the thrust washer (17) and retain with a new circlip (16).
Second gear
Thrust washer
Circlip
Fit sixth gear (15) with the selector fork groove facing away from the output sprocket end. Ensure that the oil holes in the gear DO NOT align with the corresponding oil hole in the output shaft.
If the oil holes in the sixth gear are aligned with the corresponding hole in the output shaft, engine oil pressure and gear lubrication will be reduced.
Reduced oil pressure and gear lubrication will cause engine damage and could also lead to engine seizure resulting in loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Fit a new circlip (14) to retain sixth gear (15).
Sixth gear
Thrust washer
Circlip

Fit the thrust washer (13) to the rear of third gear (11). Fit the third gear bush (12) for fourth gear, ensuring that the oil hole in the output shaft DOES NOT align with the hole in the bush. Fit third gear (11) to the shaft with the large step side facing towards the output sprocket.
Third gear
Thrust washer
Fit fourth gear (10) with the larger step side facing away from the output sprocket.
Fit the thrust washer (9) and retain with a new circlip (8).
Fourth gear
Thrust washer
Circlip

Fit the fifth gear (7) to the output shaft (19) with the selector fork groove facing towards the output sprocket. Ensure that the oil holes in the gear DO NOT align with the corresponding oil hole in the output shaft.
If the oil holes in the fifth gear are aligned with the corresponding hole in the input shaft, engine oil pressure and gear lubrication will be reduced.
Reduced oil pressure and gear lubrication will cause engine damage and could also lead to engine seizure resulting in loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Fit the first gear thrust washer (5) and bearing (6).
Fifth gear
Thrust washer
Bearing
Fit first gear (4) to the shaft as marked during disassembly.
First gear
Thrust washer
Fit the thrust washer (3), needle roller bearing (2) and bearing sleeve (1) to the end of the shaft.
title: Output Shaft - Assembly
